paragraphs.text: This is the story of Hapu who lives in Ancient Egypt. Hapu works with his father, a goldsmith. They work long, hard hours making gold tables and chairs, but they are poor. Then one day Hapu has an idea which will change the lives of him and his father - he decides to make a beautiful gold necklace for Queen Cleopatra.

This is the story of Hapu. He lives in Ancient Egypt at the time of Queen Cleopatra. His father, Bak, has a small factory. He makes gold tables and chairs. Hapu helps him. He is a "fireboy". Every day he pushes a long handle up and down. The work is hot and very hard. But what can he and his father do? They are poor people. They need to make money.

paragraphSections.imgAlt: Bak and Hapu works hard in the factory.

radio.title: Choose the correct answer.
radio.question: 1.1 Where does Hapu live?
1.2 What does Bak make in the factory?
1.3 Are they rich?

paragraphs.text: Every evening they sit beside the Nile. Bak talks to his son about the factory, tomorrow's work — everything. "One day we're going to be very rich," he tells Hapu. "Are we?" The fireboy looks into his father's tired eyes. "Yes," Bak smiles. "I don't know how and I don't know when, but we are." Then he stands up. "Come on," he says. "It's late. Let's go home."

paragraphSections.imgAlt: Bak and Hapu talks beside the river Nile.

radio.title: Choose the correct answer.
radio.question: 2.1 Where do they usually go every evening?

options.label: They go to the Nile and sit beside it.

radio.question: 2.2 What do they talk about?

options.label: They talk about the factory, tomorrow's work — everything.

radio.question: 2.3 Does Bak know how and when they're going to be rich?

paragraphs.text: Three days later Hapu and Bak are making a table. It is very hot in the room. Suddenly, Bak stops work. "What is it, father?" Hapu asks. "Is something wrong?" "I don't know," Bak answers. He closes his eyes. "It's my head. I can't..." And then he falls on the ground. "Father!" Hapu runs to Bak and puts one hand under his head. "Father — are you all right?"

paragraphSections.imgAlt: Suddenly, Bak begins to feel sick and falls to the ground.

radio.title: Choose the correct answer.
radio.question: 3.1 What happens three days later?

paragraphs.text: The next day Bak stays in bed. "I'm sorry Hapu," he says. "I want to work but I can't. I'm ill." Hapu is very sad. "Father works too hard," he thinks. "That's why he's ill. We need more money - but what can I do?" Then he has an idea. "Of course!" he thinks "I must make something for somebody very rich. Somebody like ... the Queen!"

paragraphSections.imgAlt: Hapu talks to Bak while he's in bed.

radio.title: Choose the correct answer.
radio.question: 4.1 Can Bak work the next day?
4.2 What idea does Hapu have.

options.label: He wants to make a necklace for the Queen.

paragraphs.text: Bak is ill for two weeks. In that time, Hapu makes a lot of tables and chairs. But only tables and chairs. He makes a gold necklace, too. "There!" he thinks late one night. "It's ready. He smiles. The necklace is very beautiful. "Queen Cleopatra is going to like this, "Hapu thinks. "She's going to pay a lot of money for it, too. I know she is."

paragraphSections.imgAlt: Hapu makes a beautiful necklace to the Queen Cleopatra.

radio.title: Choose the correct answer.
radio.question: 5.1 How long is Bak ill for?
5.2 Why is Hapu happy?

options.label: Because he made a gold necklace for the queen
Because he made a table and a chair for the queen.

paragraphs.text: The next morning he goes to Cleopatra's palace. The necklace is in a bag under his shirt. "What do you want?" asks a palace guard. There are two guards. Each one has a sword. "I want to see the queen," Hapu answers. Both guards laugh. Go home, boy," says one of them. "Queen Cleopatra doesn't see people like you."

paragraphSections.imgAlt: Two man stands in front of the palace and don't let Hapu in.

radio.title: Choose the correct answer.
radio.question: 6.1 Where does Hapu go the next morning?
6.2 What does he have in a bag under his shirt?
6.3 How many guards are there at the palace?
6.4 Can he pass the guards?

paragraphs.text: Hapu is very unhappy. "What do I do now?" He thinks. He leaves the palace and begins to walk home. But ten minutes later he passes two men in the market. "Cleopatra's women are coming here tomorrow morning," says one. "They're arriving very early. They want to buy lots of new clothes for her." "That's very good news," Hapu thinks.

paragraphSections.imgAlt: Happu hears two mean talking about Cleopatra visit to the market.

radio.title: Choose the correct answer.
radio.question: 7.1 Where does Hapu go after he leaves the palace?
7.2 What happens after ten minutes later?

options.label: He passes two men in the market.

radio.question: 7.3 What do Cleopatra's women want to buy?

options.label: They want to buy lots of new clothes.
They want to buy lots of new perfume.

paragraphs.text: The next day the fireboy gets up very early. He makes a cup of sweet tea for Bak. Then he goes to the market. "I can give the necklace to Cleopatra's women," he thinks. "They can give it to the Queen for me." He waits and waits. For a long time, nothing happens. Then the music starts to play. A moment later Hapu sees a long line of people. They are coming from the palace.

radio.title: Choose the correct answer.
radio.question: 8.1 What time does Hapu get up?
8.2 What does he do before he leaves the factory for the market?

options.label: He makes a cup of sweet tea for his father.
He makes a cup of coffe for his father.

paragraphs.text: Four men are carrying a very beautiful chair. A woman is sitting in it. Hapu puts one hand across his eyes. "It's the Queen"! he thinks. "She's coming, too!" A minute later Cleopatra arrives. Suddenly, everyone is very quiet. Then Hapu thinks, "This is the moment." He runs in front of Cleopatra's chair. "Stop!" he says. "Please, stop!"

paragraphSections.imgAlt: Cleopatra arrives at the market carried by four man.

radio.title: Choose the correct answer.
radio.question: How many men are carrying the queen?

options.label: Four men are carrying the Queen.
Two men are carrying the Queen.

radio.question: 9.2 What does he do when he see the queen?

options.label: He runs in front of Cleopatra's chair.

radio.question: 9.3 What does he say?

paragraphs.text: The queen looks at him. "What do you want?" she asks. Hapu gives her the necklace. "Is this really your work?" asks Cleopatra. "Yes, it is," Hapu answers. "Guards!" says Cleopatra. "Give this boy some money." She holds the necklace in her hands. "This is beautiful," she says. Then she leaves.

paragraphSections.imgAlt: The queen decides to talk to Hapu.

radio.title: Choose the correct answer.
radio.question: 10.1 What does the Queen give to Hapu?

paragraphs.text: Hapu runs home. He is very very happy. Bak is in bed. "Look!" Hapu says. He shows the money from Cleopatra's necklace to his father. "But how ...? Bak closes his eyes, then opens them again. "I don't understand," he says. Hapu smiles. He sits down and tells his father everything. At the end of the story, Bak says, "You're a good son, Hapu. Thank you."

paragraphSections.imgAlt: Hapu goes back home and show his father some money.

radio.title: Choose the correct answer.
radio.question: 11.1 What does Hapu bring back home?

paragraphs.text: That night Hapu looks up at the stars. "Now I can pay for a doctor to visit father," he thinks. "Then, after the father is strong again ... " But at that moment he stops. One of Cleopatra's guards is standing in front of him. He has a big sword. "Are you Hapu, son of Bak?" he asks. Hapu looks at him. "Yes. Yes, I am," he answers.

radio.title: Choose the correct answer.
radio.question: 12.1 What can Hapu do with the money he received from the Queen?

options.label: He can pay for a doctor to visit his father.
He can buy a new house.

paragraphs.text: "Come with me," says the guard. "Queen Cleopatra likes your work. She wants to give you a job at the palace." "But I have a job," Hapu says. "I work with my father. I can't leave him. You don't underst ..." No, You don't understand," the guard says. "When the Queen gives you a job, you take it." He puts one hand on his sword. "Now go and say goodbye to your father."

paragraphSections.imgAlt: The guard says to Hapu that the queen wanta to offer him a job.

radio.title: Choose the correct answer.
radio.question: 13.1 What does the Queen want to give to Hapu?

options.label: She wants to give him a job at the market.
She wants to give him a job at the palace.

paragraphs.text: At the palace, Cleopatra talks to Hapu. She is wearing his necklace. "I want you to live here and make lots of beautiful things for me," she says. "Thank you, Queen, of the Nile," Hapu says. "But ..." "But?" The Queen looks at Hapu. "But ... I can't live here. You see, my father is very ill and ..." Hapu tells the Queen everything.

paragraphSections.imgAlt: Hapu goes to the palace and meets Cleopatra.

radio.title: Choose the correct answer.
radio.question: 14.1 What does the Queen want from Hapu?

options.label: She wants him to live in the palace and make lots of beautiful things for her
She wants him to live in the palace and clean the floor.

paragraphs.text: At the end of Hapu's story, Cleopatra looks at him. "All right," she says. "You can go home to your father. But ..." "But?" asks Hapu. "But from today, the two of you work only for me. Do you understand?" "Oh yes!" Hapu smiles. He is very happy. Now he and his father can make lots of beautiful things and be rich. "Yes, I understand."

paragraphSections.imgAlt: Hapu is happy because he gets the job offered by the queen.

radio.title: Choose the correct answer.
radio.question: 15.1 Does Hapu accept the Queen's job?
15.2 Does Hapu leave his father and work at the palace?

options.label: No, he doens't. He goes home to work with his father.
